abstract: The bank said that its first-quarter results reflected depressed commodity prices, volatility in China and weak market sentiment.
snippet: The bank said that its first-quarter results reflected depressed commodity prices, volatility in China and weak market sentiment.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Standard Chartered, an Asia-focused bank based in London, said on Tuesday that its pretax profit fell 59 percent as the lender continued to face “challenging” trading conditions in the first quarter.

headline.main: Standard Chartered’s Pretax Profit Down 59% on ‘Challenging’ Conditions
